newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybean futures end down on correction.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybean futures end down on correction.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended down in slow trading on Tuesday on a technical correction, traders said.
The most active July 1997 contract ended at an intraday low of 3,350 yuan ($403) per tonne, losing 68 yuan. It opened at 3,410 and hit a high of 3,418.
May fell 10 to 3,350, September 35 to 3,400, November 15 to 3,435 and January 1998 contract 10 to 3,440.
Combined volume fell to 11,600 tonnes from 13,000.
Traders said many investors took profits after the gains of the past few days, resulting in the day's technical correction.
"A technical correction was responsible for today's falls but thin volume indicates soybeans still have the potential to rise," one trader said.
"Panic selling did not emerge due to improved market sentiment," he added.
Traders expected soybeans to consolidate for several days before rising again.
